channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-1336] add an automated test for HIVE-1328
item.description: This has to wait until we have a version of Hadoop which contains MAPREDUCE-1501.
item.summary: add an automated test for HIVE-1328

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Fixed in HIVE-1790.

item.title: [HIVE-1338] Fix bin/ext/jar.sh to work with hadoop 0.20 and above
item.description: bin/ext/jar.sh is not working with hadoop 0.20 and above.
item.summary: Fix bin/ext/jar.sh to work with hadoop 0.20 and above

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This patch follows the same way as bin/ext/hiveserver.sh

item.title: [HIVE-1339] Allow setting of per-job configuration properties for JDBC driver
item.description:
From the CLI you can do:

hive> set mapred.reduce.tasks = 5 ;
hive> SELECT a, b, c FROM t WHERE a < 10 ;

Currently, there is no way to set per-job configuration parameters (e.g., mapred.reduce.tasks) via the JDBC client.
item.summary: Allow setting of per-job configuration properties for JDBC driver

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Have you tried just executing the "set" command via JDBC's Statement.execute? It is actually processed by ql (not cli) so it should work; at least it did when I tested on trunk via sqlline.

It would still be nice to be able to specify these as JDBC connection properties though.

Did you mean the other way around?

CLI processes the 'set' commands, ql runs SQL statements...

At least in trunk, the processing for the set command is in this class:

ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/processors/SetProcessor.java

CLI just wraps this.

item.title: [HIVE-1340] checking VOID type for NULL in LazyBinarySerde
item.description:
NULL was not handled correctly in LazyBinarySerDe. One example is

 insert overwrite table T select '1', NULL from src limit 1;
item.summary: checking VOID type for NULL in LazyBinarySerde

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-1341] Filter Operator Column Pruning should preserve the column order
item.description: The column pruning process for the filter operator should preserve the order of input columns, otherwise it could result in miss match in columns in the down stream operators.
item.summary: Filter Operator Column Pruning should preserve the column order

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: HIVE-1341.patch fixes both 1340 & 1341.
